IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE JEFFERSON COMMUNITY COLLEGE FOUNDATION IS TO WORK IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE COLLEGE, THE COMMUNITY AND ALUMNI TO ENHANCE THE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES PROVIDED BY THE COLLEGE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE JEFFERSON COMMUNITY COLLEGE FOUNDATION IS TO WORK IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE COLLEGE, THE COMMUNITY AND ALUMNI TO ENHANCE THE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES PROVIDED BY THE COLLEGE.
IRS990.Desc: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO JEFFERSON COMMUNITY COLLEGE STUDENTS WHO ARE TRADITIONAL STUDENTS FOLLOWING THEIR SECONDARY EDUCATION, OR NON-TRADITIONAL STUDENTS WHO HAVE RETURNED TO JEFFERSON AFTER A PERIOD OF TIME AWAY TO PURSUE THEIR COLLEGE DEGREES. SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS ARE BASED ON ECONOMIC NEED AND ACADEMIC PROMISE. ALMOST 42% OF OUR STUDENT BODY RELIES UPON THE AWARD OF THIS SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM TO MAKE THEIR DREAMS OF HIGHER EDUCATION A REALITY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE FOUNDATION AWARDS GRANTS TO THE COLLEGE SUPPORTING PROGRAMS WHICH ENHANCE THE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES PROVIDED BY THE COLLEGE. GRANT FUNDS PROVIDED TO THE COLLEGE THIS YEAR INCLUDE CAPITAL CAMPAIGN FUNDS AND USE OF TITLE III GRANT FUNDS FOR THE TURF FIELD PROJECT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE ALUMNI ASSOCIATION STRIVES TO BUILD THE UNIQUE RELATIONSHIP OUR ALUMNI HAVE WITH JCC. ALUMNI SUPPORT OVER THE YEARS PROVIDES COUNTLESS STUDENTS WITH OPPORTUNITIES TO REALIZE THEIR DREAMS OF A BETTER LIFE THROUGH EDUCATION. DONATIONS TO THE JCC ALUMNI ASSOCIATION SUPPORT INITIATIVES ON CAMPUS AND STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS AT JEFFERSON. IT IS THE MISSION OF THE ALUMNI ASSOCIATION AND ALUMNI DEVELOPMENT STAFF TO BUILD STRONG RELATIONSHIPS WITH OUR ALUMNI, OUR FACULTY AND STAFF, THE COMMUNITY AND THE COLLEGE TO SUPPORT CURRENT JCC STUDENTS.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: SIDNEY POND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF AUX & ACCT SERVICES

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S FORMS 900 FOR THE YEARS ENDED 2022, 2021, AND 2020 ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE IRS, GENERALLY FOR 3 YEARS AFTER THEY WERE FILED. BASED ON IT'S ANALYSIS, THE FOUNDATION DETERMINED THAT THERE WERE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AND THAT THE FOUNDATION SHOULD PREVAIL UPON EXAMINATION BY THE TAXING AUTHORITIES.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: CENTER FOR COMMUNITY STUDIES AND TURF FIELD PROJECT

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 PROVIDED TO EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, PRIOR TO FILING FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY, WITH EACH DIRECTOR OR OFFICER REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A WRITTEN DISCLOSURE DETAILING THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
NO CHANGES IN PROCEDURE FROM THE PRIOR YEAR. FINANCE COMMITTEE ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND SELECTION OF INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT.
